Reviews.Title: “ok place to stay and that's it!!”
Reviews.Author: imad_kaddouh
Reviews.Content: Went to this place to watch a HABS game, place is OK, lots of young annoying crowd which is not the hotel's fault. Rooms are basic and somewhat clean. The elevators would work one second but not the other which was very annoying. our room was not ready at 2:00PM which again was very annoying since we had to drag out luggage and go waste time. Stay was ok but i would not go back better places for the same price elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “nothing special”
Reviews.Author: mary s
Reviews.Content: The booking website I used to make my reservation ranked this as 4*. I am posting this review to let you know it is DEFINITELY not 4*. It's okay, no major issues with it - but its nothing special. It's a 3* place. No reason not to stay there, the beds were comfy and they had free wifi but don't expect anything special.

Reviews.Title: “everything you need”
Reviews.Author: abesinVT
Reviews.Content: we were new to Montreal and just going for a quick getaway - we had no idea where this hotel was located in relation to restaurants and sights in the city. Turns out it's just on the edge of a very studenty, hip, university type environment, walking distance to this entire area. We found the service to be excellent, the staff very friendly, the rooms and bathroom clean and perfectly suitable. The only downside...the restaurant in the building. Breakfast buffet was major league gross looking. We opted to go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Eh...”
Reviews.Author: R S
Reviews.Content: It's functional, but not impressive in any respect. I think it's an old Qualtiy Inn with a coat of paint. I had a few noisy neighbors and lots of empty beer bottles in the hallway in the morning. For a business traveller, this hotel is not really up to par. The breakfast bar food was all very cold- yuck. Beds are hard as a rock!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nope... not for me.”
Reviews.Author: BC_Cowboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a bunch of days a couple months ago and wouldn't do it again. I agree with the prior review that this a 2* at MOST. I had to be changed rooms twice (the first had hair everywhere and stains all over the pillows) because of issues. Just driving up to the Espresso makes you wonder what you have gotten yourself into - it does not look very nice from the outside. A lot of interesting people inside the lobby and overall the place just seemed very run down and not overly clean. This is an old Days Inn so set your expectations accordiningly. That being said, if you are just there for a single night to check out a hockey game with your friends and get a low price it would be good - it's close to the Bell Center and much like if you were in Vegas - you're probably only using it as a place to crash.

Reviews.Title: “This is barely a 2-star hotel- very barely”
Reviews.Author: DetailsDetails
Reviews.Content: Some travel sites have this property listed as a three or even four star hotel! It's definitely not. It used to be a Days Inn, but I would hesitate to say it was even that nice. It's in dreadful condition- everything is old and fairly worn out- the furnishings, the curtains, the carpet, the lobby, the exercise room. And nothing was clean- the bathroom was dirty, the supposed-to-be-sealed cups were half unwrapped, there were random tolietries left out (conditioner, but no shampoo, miss-matched soaps). Machines in the exercise room were left dirty. The elevator that I was in on my way down to check was... dirty (without getting graphic). The hotel only has 2 elevators- it was tough to believe no one had noticed that and/or cleaned it up. I didn't mention it to the front desk staff- as they seemed unhelpful, in a hurry and generally annoyed in my previous interactions with them. This would be an ok stay for someone who is going to the Bell Centre (it's right around the corner) and won't be in the hotel long or someone who doesn't expect any basic hotel amenities. It's not walking distance to downtown proper, but there is a taxi stand at the hotel and the metro is close by.

Reviews.Title: “loved the suite”
Reviews.Author: dam_smoke
Reviews.Content: booked the hotel based on price - a good one, but spent a couple dollars more on the suite. had a mini-fridge, a microwave and a sofa bed. 2 hairdryers in the washroom. a separate makeup desk. a heater in the monster bathroom, it was maybe 15ft X 15ft. the bath/shower had three shower heads positioned at different heights. honestly, i didn't care, but the wife went on and on about it. she said the jets were very powerful and it had a jacuzzi. best quilt/duvet we have ever experienced. must have been 7 pillows on the bed, and the wife wanted to steal one (don't worry, we didn't). an actual computer in the room at the desk. not high speed, but it was enough for email and it was free.

Reviews.Title: “BAD Hotel Espresso”
Reviews.Author: Genny26
Reviews.Content: The light was not working in the room, only the lamps! The door stopper in the bathroom was broken and could cut our feet if we would walk on it. It took 5 minutes of running water to finally get not so warm water in the bath. We put the heat at maximum but it never warm the room enough. Unfriendly employees with a non profesional attitude on the phone when making the reservation, neither at the front desk, the employee was angry because I parked my car in the interior garage before completing the transaction at the front desk! I reserved for 2 queen beds but found only 1 king bed in the room! Breakfast was supposed to open at 7am, it opened 15 minutes late... I don't have a positive thing to say about this hotel except that the fresh orange juice was delicious!

Reviews.Title: “an OK place to stay”
Reviews.Author: judithO
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks a little shabby from the outside and the hallways etc were very plain. However, the staff on the front desk were very helpful and our rooms were clean. The rooms had laminate flooring and a computer for personal use. My friends; room had a fridge but mine did not. The lighting in the room could have been better. The room staff were a little over eager. On the day we were leaving, my room was made up while we were having breakfast. Surely this should have waited until I had checked out. Location is good, just off Rene Levesque and close to the metro. I booked through hot wire and had a very good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Fine”
Reviews.Author: London078
Reviews.Content: I went away with three friends on a cheap break to Montreal and we booked this hotel as it was offering the best rates. As some of the reviews below are very negative, I was dreading seeing the hotel. HOWEVER, I was pleasantly surprised. The lobby was in a decent condition, clean, well-kept and check-in was fast (maybe because we checked in a bit later, at 5pm). Our room was a large, very clean room with two queen sized beds which were lovely and comfortable after a long day of strolling around the city. There were no problems with noise at all for us, and we were blown away by what a great location the hotel is in. Literally 3 minutes from St Catherine Street with supermarkets, pharmacies, restaurants and clothes shops galore. Also we were about 5 minutes from Crescent Street where some of the clubs are. All in all, we were very impressed by the hotel given the price. It's not a 4 star luxuorious hotel, but it certainly is a clean, well-maintained hotel in a prime spot of Montreal. Enjoy Montreal! P.S. My only complaint would be the cost of the room telephones. A 2 minute call to Toronto cost me $7! But I guess that's typical of any hotel.

Reviews.Title: “How is this place rated 4 star?”
Reviews.Author: fab s
Reviews.Content: I booked this place off booking.com.... I couldn't complain about the price, But you know when something is too good to be true? It usually is.I booked the room got there stayed 5 minutes before my girlfriend pulled a fit and left and had to book an other hotel end up being an expensive night.... This place is posted as a 4 star hotel on the website, with nice pictures. In reality the place is dirty smelly with a mix match of banged up furniture... And the list goes on... I've been trying to get a refund for a week, with no success so far. False advertisement, Bad experience

Reviews.Title: “Great location; room so-so”
Reviews.Author: chgo919
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located just a block and a half away from the subway (orange and green lines) and walking distance to Bell Centre. For that reason alone, it's a great place for the money. However, the memory I have about the "memory foam" bed...hard as a rock. Argh. And we were there on a weekend when there was a home game. LOTS of teenage and 20-something fans. Lots of pizza boxes and beer bottles in the hallway. At one point, we had to take the stairs because kids had clogged up the elevators and it was crazy trying to get out of the building and on our way. Bottom line: Although it wasn't horrible, I don't know that I'd book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: dean16000
Reviews.Content: Honestly I booked this via hotwire, and after I booked it I got scared becasue reviews were not very good. I called hotwire and they said if you get there and are not happy, call us and we will place you elsewhere. So I arrived, they brew fresh Espresso, which is really good. And offer you a cup at check-in. The room was big, sheets were very clean, the beds were confortable, and a fridge in the room. I'm glad they had free internet access, parking was easy, and free becasue there is a street right behind the hotel that offers free street parking. The only bad really was the hotel needs updating, and also you can hear everyone walking in the hallway, the walls are not sound proofed well. Honestly I probably would stay here again. Location is perfect to all food, shops, and transporation.

Reviews.Title: “Booked this last minute 3* with Hotwire while in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: taquitogrande
Reviews.Content: Oddly located hotel close to St. Catherine downtown Montreal strip. Parking at an adjacent lot outside the hotel was cheap in comparison to other hotels. $10/per night. Hotel was ok for the price, and included internet access. The first room we got had problems with the toilet which was in constant flush, so we were given another room on the same floor. To my surprise not only were the rooms quite large but they also had laminate floors which is uncommon to see in a hotel room. Would I willingly book this hotel again, probably not; but if hotwire assigned it to me, I wouldn't be disappointed if the price was right!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, mediocre hotel”
Reviews.Author: BevyC
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was great and is very close to the subway. The room however had ants crawling everywhere which was a little disturbing. In addition, the rooms were poorly insulated as you can hear people in the hallways and closing of doors in the rooms around you. There was a computer in the room which was convenient to look up directions and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Vivek R
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through one of the deals on hotwire and were mainly looking for a night's stay. This hotel is located right at downtown, close to all the places of interested. We stayed for a night on our way to Quebec city. The rooms are fine, relatively spacious, 2 double beds, TV and a computer with access to internet - which is all we pretty much needed for a night. The room and bathrooms were clean. There was some noise from movement in the corridor, but nothing that kept us awake all night. Check-in was smooth, parking is a bit expensive at $ 22 (with taxes). We didn't eat at the hotel, so can't really comment on the food. To avoid some of the reservation issues mentioned by the other reviewers, I would recommend calling a day ahead and ensuring that the room is confirmed which is what we did. I would say, for the price, this is a good and decent place to stay especially if you are looking for access to downtown and old montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Below average”
Reviews.Author: Habscouple
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Espesso for multiple nights during a trip to Montreal to watch the Habs play. This was my third trip to Montreal and we chose this hotel due to location. -Check in was slow, they were unable to find our reservation. The front desk staff searched under my last name, but no luck. They finally located it, under the other guests name in the room (same last name). -The room itself was spacious and the flooring was new and pretty nice. The room had a flat screen TV and a view of the Bell Centre. The bathroom had a large crack in the ceiling and the shower curtain wouldn't stay closed. One of the chairs in the room had visable stains on it, as did one of the pillows. After a shower the second day, I was drying off and felt something cold on my leg. I looked down to find a bottle cap stuck to the towel (we did not have beer in our room so it was not ours). A nice feature was the computer in the room, but the internet connection was hit and miss. There was a coffee maker but no mini fridge. The beds were comfortable, as were the pillows. Shower pressure was fine. -Noise was not an issue. We were located near the elevator but didn't hear much noise from the hall. There were a large group of young adults that arrived by bus, but as noted we did not have any issues with them partying or making noise. -The maid service was disapointing. Although they were polite, they did not come to make up the room until after 5 pm both of the first two days. Considering we were out of the room most of the day, coming back to find the room not done was less than perfect. We ended up only getting the room done twice because of this. -We did not get a chance to try the restaurant, as when we went down to eat at 1:45 pm one day we were informed they closed at 2 pm. The store in the lobby was also closed at wierd times. -The lobby area seemed to be constantly filled with people lounging around. I assume they were guests, but each time we went down the area was packed. -Location was very good for us, close to the Bell Centre and shopping. There are a few restaurants very close, and several more a short walk away. -Check out was fine, no issues. The front desk staff helped out by calling us a taxi which was great. In closing, I really wanted to give this hotel a better rating, but based on the areas noted above, a 2 out of 5 is about right. I doubt I would stay here again when I return to Montreal, but those looking for a place close to the Bell Centre might consider it. The price was reasonable, but just too many issues for my liking.

Reviews.Title: “Espresso to go!”
Reviews.Author: NancyKlassen
Reviews.Content: What great fortune to have DealFind send an e-mail for a special night at Hotel Espresso for two w/sparkling wine just as my mini three day vacation was booked through West Jet's always friendly and cost effective seat-sales! You can throw away your GPS App with this destination right in the downtown. Bell Centre; home to the Canadiens hockey is just a block away which makes Hotel Espresso the "Hab",I mean hub of Montreal for future visits with my husband a special Hab fan. This was my first trip to Montreal in many years and I was loaded down with needed "stuff" for my son who lives there. My ill husband could not accompany me for this pre-Christmas junket and on my own with little knowledge of the city to navigate its many one-ways and detours a central hotel adjacent to public transport or walking distance was paramount. WestJet gave coupons for Budget and a minivan for the 133 kilos of X-Cargo and maxed out luggage w/bike in a stealth black Dodge fuel-saver "new" Grand Caravan for the duration and may I mention that Vic is a very special Budget Agent. Arrival by WestJet's polite and genuinely helpful crew on Red-Eye was seamless and pleasant with a three hour differential from Vancouver. Highway signage is wonderful by other cities' standards, despite Quebec's monumental undertaking for region-wide restoration of the aging road infrastructure. Just follow the great signage from the airport to Montreal "Centreville" and 18 minutes later in "cautionary" slow speed due to environmental and cost effective "ARRET"'s everywhere and no right turns on the less usual x-lights, you emerge off a turnpike and amazingly there was Rue Guy with the well-lit and inviting sign for Hotel Espresso right off the corner. The professionally engaged; friendly, and genuinely, amenable management that began with the previous week's phoned arrangements, until departure with secured underground parking right downtown for my last afternoon had staff I saw, ensuring each guest's needs and desires with all queries fulfilled to their satisfaction. Additionally, to its central and accessible location; their great Sunday brunch at a reasonably cost; full-menu restaurant, clean and inviting rooms, and other facilities (i.e. full spa; gym, and outdoor pool) make this a great hotel to return to after every memorable evening at any one of the entertainment; nightclub or romantic restaurants that make Montreal famous. Did I mention that you are greeted with complimentary "real" espresso coffee with every tour past the lobby? We all enjoyed the sparkling Spanish wine on ice. We did make one wonderful side trip to "The Willow Inn" in Hudson for a lovely Sunday brunch overlooking the lake and watching the annual Santa Claus parade down the main street which will not be soon forgotten. This was one of the best spontaneous trip due to the wonderful people that provided service at WestJet & West Jet Cargo from Vancouver and through to Montreal home; Budget Car Rental, and particularly the excellent accommodations at Hotel Espresso. Thank you all.

Reviews.Title: “One Night in Hell!”
Reviews.Author: Rob M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Espresso from Oct 27-29, 2011 (inclusive), and, given what transpired on the final night, would have to say it was a terrible experience. The first two nights were fine. The room was spacious and reasonably clean. There was a large TV and a desktop computer with constant connection to the internet. There was also a mini fridge. The restaurant did leave much to be desired; it was over-priced ($12 per person for buffet breakfast), it took the staff an inexplicable amount of time to replenish the food and some items, such as the sausages, were overcooked (to the point of being near-rock hard). While I did appreciate the location, in downtown and a short walk from the Bell Centre, the police station, several good restaurants and stores, I felt they over charged for the parking (more than $10 per day, despite being a guest). The first two nights were quiet enough, but the third night (the Saturday before Hallow'een) was a night in hell. I stayed in and went to bed early as I had to leave early in the morning for Ottawa and then on to the Maritimes. Around 10:30 pm, I was hauled from my sleep by revelers parading up and down the hall yelling, whooping and making pirate noises. They were also dressed like pirates. They had just returned from the Montreal-Boston game (Montreal had won) and they were drinking and partying in the hall. I figured they would celebrate a few minutes and then head back to their rooms, but they didn't. About 45 minutes later I called the front desk to complain and I asked them to deal with the noise. Nothing happened. The noise finally stopped around midnight, when he revelers headed out to the streets. I was again pulled from my sleep an hour or so later when the revelers returned. This time I yelled at them through the door and they did head into their rooms and it quieted down for about an hour, when I was -- for the third time -- pulled from my sleep by excessive noise in the room next door. That noise sounded suspiciously like a plumber replacing pipes. There was an inexplicable amount of banging and clanging (especially for 2:30 am) and finally, very tired and very angry, I called the front desk again. I was assured someone would be sent to check on the noise. Nothing happened. When checking out, I complained about the noise and said I had considered calling the police. The clerk told me calling the police would have solved nothing, and that I should put myself in his shoes, that he could not control the other guests. Well, that annoyed me even further. I told him he needed to put himself in my shoes, a paying guest who was trying to get a night of sleep, and who, given that he had paid for the room, was entitled to a restful sleep. I also told the clerk that was the first time in all my years that I had stayed in a hotel where the staff allowed guests to make such noise (even though the hotel stated in its ad on Expedia that id did not allow partying and proms and the such). I told him he could have asked the guests to quiet down and if they refused, he could have asked them to leave and if they refused, he could have called the police and ask them to remove the guests. I also suggested he could have moved us to another room to make it up to us. A couple of days after I checked out, I sent a note -- and complaint -- about my stay to the hotel's manager. More than a month later, I still have not received a reply. The clerk did allow us two nights of free parking, but that was of little consolation for virtually a night of lost sleep. I will never stay at Hotel Espresso again. The noise was bad enough, but yes, the hotel staff could not prevent the guests from making the noise, but they could have handled the situation better when it did happen.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but often noisy”
Reviews.Author: awd1970
Reviews.Content: Through Expedia, I booked this hotel for three nights (Oct 27-29, 2011). The first two nights were fine - the third night was awful which I will detail in a moment. The location is ideal in downtown Montreal, near two Metro stations and a stone's throw from the Bell Centre. The hotel (formerly a Days Inn, I believe) was clean and comfortable with an in-room desktop computer available with free internet - which we found was a big plus. The bathroom could have used some updating though. The lobby was a bit dingy and the same clientele always seemed to be hanging out there watching TV - not sure why since every room should have a TV. We ate at the hotel restaurant one morning and had the breakfast buffet. For about $12, it seemed overpriced for what we got and when many food items were depleted, such as bacon for example, they weren't replenished. As I said the first two nights were fine but the third night was a disaster. From early evening until the wee hours of the morning, we heard loud voices and laughter, both in the room next door and in the hallway. It was as if a party had taken over much of the fourth floor. We even heard banging and clanging from the room next door - almost like a plumber was fixing the pipes at 2am! We called the front desk twice but the noise never subsided. When we checked out the next morning, we complained to the desk clerk who told us there was nothing he could have done and calling the police would have been a waste of time. Expedia mentioned, and I quote directly: "The hotel does not allow partying in rooms" - which is totally misleading. A party was going on but we didn't want to attend - we wanted to sleep! The desk clerk only charged us for one day of parking (as opposed to three days) but for what we had to endure, we should have had at least the third night free. I would not stay at this hotel again and if you decide to book it, be warned!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: CapnKaos
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel that has seen better days, it's not terrible but it's not great either. 3 stars is possibly the best they can aspire to. I booked this as a last minute trip to Montreal, literally I booked it the night before through Expedia and got what I thought was a decent rate. For the price I paid, I expected certain things and for the most part got them. Unfortunately there were some issues with my stay. First the good: It's a good location on Rue Guy practically on the corner with Rene Levesque so you're right downtown. The Bell Centre is practically at the door and the Metro station is close by & you're within walking distance of Ste Catherine. Beds were clean, room was tidied every day, free WiFi or a rather antiquated PC is in the room so you can use that if you prefer. Didn't try the restaurant on site or the room service so I can't comment on those. Free coffee in the room. Now for the bad: Room was not ready on arrival and was told I needed to come back at 3pm. That's not really the hotel's fault but after a 6 hour drive it's nice to be able to relax in your room. The air conditioner was some huge montrosity that didn't work properly and leaked all over the carpet. One night I woke up at 3am and the air conditioning had stopped working and was pumping out hot air. It took 30 minutes to get it back on.The windows didn't open so it wasn't possible to get any fresh air in the room. Tiles in the shower were cracked, and there was no grate over the drain. If you dropped the soap, it would be gone. And when turned off, the shower head leaked for a while directly over the drain. If you took a shower before going to sleep, you were in for a noisy time until it abated. Also on the weekend, the bar downstairs turns into a very loud discotheque. If you're on the lower floors, be prepared to either sleep with earplugs or wait until it closes for the night before sleeping. And while the coffee was free, the pot was not cleaned when I first went to use it and neither was it cleaned all subsequent times. Thankfully the cups for said coffee were all paper and disposable. In conclusion, it's not a great hotel and the service is a little lacking. The price was reasonable for Downtown Montreal and the location was good but the cons outweigh the pros and the next time in Montreal I will be choosing a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Poor hygiene and in desperate need of renovations: horrible”
Reviews.Author: Annik C
Reviews.Content: Geez where to start: the mistmatched furniture, the funky smell, the mini fridge making more noise than a plan trying to land and the very poor hygiene standards of this hotel makes my skin want to crawl. Upon arrival, I noticed that the bathroom grout was black and that a lot of dust was in the bathroom but the worst was finding that there was no fitted sheet for this hotel only a tucked in sheet that showed a stained mattress and yes: pubic hair! I found also some in the ice bucket in the bathroom. I asked to see a manager and instead, I was sent the maid who was quite intimidating. Since it was 9:30 at night, I really didn't have the choice but to stay.My neck and back ached the next day because of the terrible mattress. I would consider renaming Hotel Hellspresso for my experience. DO not waist a single penny on this dump.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy but nice”
Reviews.Author: Cal0n
Reviews.Content: This is a nice, conveniently located hotel but it is certainly past it's prime and would greatly benefit from a revamp. The main issue I had with the hotel was the noise from guests talking at the top of their voices in the corridors to the housekeeping staff starting at 8 and making ridiculous amounts noise, including yelling to each other to people coming back drunk during the night. I have never experienced such a noisy hotel. It must have very thin walls. I was lucky that I had ear plugs in my wash bag from my days travelling. The rooms are of a good size and the bathroom had a bath. The hotel is well located for the metro, the airport bus and downtown Montreal. Breakfast (not included) was ok. We got the hotel as a secret saver one on Expedia (so you don't see which hotel it is until you've booked) I would have been disappointed to pay full price for it. There is an excellent restaurant "La Mere Michel" down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: CTCAtravel
Reviews.Content: The people at the desk were extremely rude. When, in the middle of the night, a drunken guest in a nearby room began screaming and slamming doors, it took them several hours to fix the problem and in the morning, they didn't even apologize or offer restitution. We almost had to call the police. The other hotel guests were at times scary, and the hotel is loud and located next to the train and a busy street. We got no sleep. The shower didn't drain or turn on correctly, and the spout almost fell off. I would avoid this hotel at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel conveniently located in downtown”
Reviews.Author: julius p
Reviews.Content: Curteous staff, nice lobby, clean, spacious rooms equipped with a computer with free internet access. Willcome back and will recommend to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: RAYWATTY
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights as part of a tour. Room was spacious and clean. The A/c a bit noisy but it worked ok and location was excellent for downtown and shops. Breakfast was a little bit on the spartan side but served its purpose and the reception staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Awful...don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: snardz
Reviews.Content: I got a deal from hotwire last minute to Montreal. They don't let you see the hotel until you are done booking it. Anyway, got to the hotel and everything was fine until we got into the room... The air condition started leaking and made a huge pool on the floor. They moved us to another room where we then realized that the air-condition was broken and would freeze up and not start back up after being on for about an hour. It was already around midnight and we decided not to change rooms and just deal with it. The place is really run down...it used to be Days Inn. Mildew in the shower, cracked paint on the ceiling. Yes the location is great but overall it was a headache. We requested a late checkout the day before leaving and still got harassed by the front desk when we were leaving late.

Reviews.Title: “Everything went as expected”
Reviews.Author: Robert W
Reviews.Content: I went to Montreal on labor day weekend for a wedding in my girlfriends family..this hotel was recommended by one of her uncles. Extremely well located we parked and walked to almost everything.Staff was very polite 24 hr FREE ESPRESSO coffee (Good Stuff) what treat :). Room was spacious and clean. All in all was worth what we paid a lot cheaper than San Francisco

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Cruising on a sailboat in FL Keys
Reviews.Title: “Lots of potential but in need of freshening up”
Reviews.Author: DocFraud
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated and has a great attached parking garage that provides climate controlled parking, a real plus in a city where the temps can get to -20 frequently. The beds are new and the bedding is of high quality and very comfortable. The rest of the room however is very tired. The carpets are stained, the furniture is chipped and the bath room is held together with silicon caulking, The shower is OK and there is plenty of hot water, but the grout is in desperate need of cleaning. The window style airconditioners work, but they are noisy and we preferred to leave them off. The free wifi is good and the connections are fast and stable. We also had a desk top computer provided in our room, It looked like something from the last century but it worked well enough to open "Hotmail" Definitely bring your own if you plan on doing any serious surfing. There are clues that the hotel used to be a Day's Inn which has recently been cut loose from the fold. If the quality of the beds and bedding are any indication of what is in store for the hotel then there is potential for a 3+ star property here, but first the owners need to buy some furniture, install new carpets and fix the bath rooms. I would stay here again if I was convinced that some reno's had taken place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: markb28
Reviews.Content: Paid Â£105 for two nights on hotwire. For the price absolutely fine. Good points 5 quick stops from bus station. Very comfy beds and bedding Decent tv with mpix movie channel Decent bathroom Basic gym and pool Spacious room with 2 queens Wood floor Air con works well Let us check in at 1pm Has shop and drink machines Bad points Air con bit noisy Front desk

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: alynnem
Reviews.Content: Great location, the hotel was clean but a bit noisy - thin walls! Some of the front desk personnel weren't terribly friendly, but I can't say they were rude either. The restaurant was not good at all and you can't order room service in the morning because they have a buffet? In saying that, there are so many excellent restaurants in Montreal it would be a shame to eat hotel food anyway! The rooms are quite plain but it's a clean hotel. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Montreal and enjoyed our stay at Hotel Espresso!”
Reviews.Author: Cubacana
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a clean place to sleep and a great downtown location I would recommend this hotel. Our room was cleaned every day and when I had an issue with the blow dryer, they brought me another one right away. Front desk was friendly and we had a great time in Montreal. Loved that we were only 2 small blocks from St. Catherines and had a Shoppers Drug Mart right at the corner, so if you forgot anything...no worries you can pick it up there! If I had anything negative to say it would be the air conditioning unit was loud so when I was trying to fall asleep it woke me up a couple of times. My wish list would have been to have had a bar fridge in the room, but other than that we enjoyed our stay at the hotel. You are not in the hotel very much anyways...so for what we needed it was very good. I would stay there again without hesitation. Merci Montreal, had a great time!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, would definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: Lyndzo
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 3 nights for our anniversary. We used the Top Secret Hotels deal and were very pleased with this hotel. We expected just an average hotel and we felt it was better. The rooms are beautiful, clean and you can control the A/C which is a plus in this heat. The room had a computer, it was slow but who needs a computer when you're on vacation? We enjoyed our stay and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: ymm555
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Hotel Espresso. The hotel was clean and friendly. The closest metro stop and food options are approx 2 blocks away (the hotel is located on the edge of what is considered the downtown area). My only problem was the inability to use a safe. The kids loved the pool and there was a computer with free wifi access in each room!

Reviews.Title: “You can do better...the staff is overwhelmed.”
Reviews.Author: DCtravels11
Reviews.Content: Arriving at 5:30 we were sent to a room not yet cleaned. Our next room was better, but smelled like it had once been a smoking room. The carpet outside was never cleaned during our entire stay. A downpour caused us to eat in the restaurant 1st night and there was one poor guy serving everyone. On the positive side hotel is near metro, street full of good restaurant choices, and clientele is very diverse. Still I think they could do netter and so could you.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Terrible!”
Reviews.Author: CouCr
Reviews.Content: I don't normally write reviews on hotels, especially not a bad review, but I felt someone needs to warn the rest of travellers out there. The rooms look nothing like the pictures they have placed on the internet. We came across 2 nice staff members that spoke english, one worked in the restaurant and the other on front desk. The young woman who checked us in told us originally that they did not have a room ready for us at 4:30pm, after a few minutes of her looking she magically found a room. When we finally got up to the room we realized she hadn't magically found one, she'd taken an out of order room and placed it back in order for us. The maintance man was leaving the room as we opened the door. Once in the room we took a look around, once the a/c finally come on it ratted and made a loud enough noise for us to want to turn it off, the bathroom had no towels and was filthy. I called the front desk for towels and she said it would be a little while as the linen "had not arrived yet". We thought for sure she was joking so we asked a housekeeper on our floor, her response was "no towels until 6pm" when we asked how we were supposed to shower with no towels her response was "i duno i came here by bus" .... Finally I went down to the front desk to try and get a room upgrade or a room change, anything really. I had to speak to a different lady who rolled her eyes at me and handed me off to the next young woman. Finally I was moved to a down graded room that at least had a flat screen and furniture that was more than likely bought 8 years ago instead of 20. The next day we came back to the room at 5 and our room had still not be cleaned. We had to leave the room and go swimming so she would clean our room. On the day of departure the housekeeper actually came into our room at 10am- check out is not until noon. After working in the hospitality industry I thought they would have done something to compensate our stay - they did nothing. Such a joke.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: bl00
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from July 30 to Aug 1 and have stayed at many hotels throughout Downtown Montreal over the years. I'll say that this hotel is just ok. The good: The beds were quite comfortable. Location is excellent - a short walk to everything, Starbucks down the street, close to the highway, shopping, etc. Price was relatively cheap for a very busy weekend. Free wifi - and there are computers with free Internet access in the room as well The bad: Hallways felt like you were in the Haunted Mansion - there was a weird smell as well (7th floor). Door didn't close properly so we literally had to shut it hard to close it. Lots of drunk people wandering the halls - you can't really fault the hotel for this but I guess it is the clientele they attract. If you don't plan on staying in the room very much, or if you are a rowdy partier then this hotel will suit you well. If looking for something more quiet or posh, then it is best to go elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Great for groups or singles who want to part....Not for Couples or Families”
Reviews.Author: JOS1898
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Montreal and stayed at the Hotel Espresso (July 29 to Aug 1). Overall a great hotel, centrally located - two blocks from 2 different subways stations and a block from the Express Airport Bus, St. Catherine street, and Rene Leveque BUT this place is not for someone who wants a relaxing stay. The room doors slam shut and can be heard from one end of the hall to the other. If you speak louder than a whisper in the halls, it sounds like the person is in the room with you. There were bus fulls of kids / teenagers coming and going so it was a noisey stay. And there was only 2 elevators??!? Ridiculous! As for the actual rooms, I had a room with 2 queen beds. It was spacious and clean. The bathroom was clean and a good size. If you need a place to stay while visiting the city and don't mind the noise, then I recommend staying here. But if you want some peace and quite after a long day of touring the city, best to go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price, Good Times and Will come back.”
Reviews.Author: jbomben
Reviews.Content: Going to Montreal was something that a few friends and i recently did and we stayed at Hotel Espresso in Montreal. We decided to go down for three nights from Thursday afternoon to Sunday morning. Room size was very good and very clean, there was 4 guys in a standard room with two beds. The room had hardwood floors which i thought was unusual but it had a great touch to the room. The outdoor pool was great and we used that alot during the warm Quebec days and even in the mornings before heading out. The staff went above and beyond what I expected, they were great during the stay. I lost my key and after showing some proof of ID and everything, I was given a free replacement key. Having Espresso every morning was also very refreshing to wake up too. The location of the hotel was the key for the group to be staying in the hotel, we wanted something downtown but we didnt want to overpay. In this case, we do feel like we underpaid for this hotel. Location wise, it's close to pretty much everything. We walked from the bars and the clubs every night and had no problems with that. Food wise, there's a good BBQ place that is actually open 24 hours a day about 1 minute away from the hotel. If your hungry enough, try the Jack Daniels burger. I would tell my friends and family to go too this hotel, we had nothing but good experiences with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service!!”
Reviews.Author: ISSA13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for one night while we attended the Paul McCartney concert at the Bell Centre. We chose this hotel because of its proximity to the Bell Centre â€“ 5 min walk. Location is great â€“ walking distance St. Catherine street, restaurants, bars and shopping. We booked directly with the hotel â€“ reservation agent was polite and helpful. Hotel is reasonably priced. We had originally booked a standard room and upon arrival we were upgraded to a junior suite. Rooms are very spacious and clean. The hotel staff was very accommodating and courteous. Hotel parking was easy and convenient. The hotel restaurant was great for a quick morning breakfast. We didnâ€™t have time to use the outdoor pool and spa, but definitely look forward to our return at the end of August to take advantage of these services.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Clean, Central”
Reviews.Author: Robert800
Reviews.Content: Two large queen beds and extra roll-away as we had 5 in the room and it was large and spacious enough to accomodate. Also, had outdoor pool for kids, which was great. Room was clean and looked like it had been recently renovated. Indoor, underground parking was extra, also outdoor parking, next door for less money. Rate was great and value of spend was fantastic for such a central location. Did not eat on site as lot's near by within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Could not recommend it”
Reviews.Author: kezkon
Reviews.Content: Made the mistake of not pre-booking a hotel before travelling to Montreal therefore we took the advice of the Tourist Information Office who assured us it was at least a 3 star hotel. The service was sadly lacking. There was no booklet in room to advise of services. There was a breakfast tray sitting in the corridor opposite our room for more than 24 hours. The hallway carpet hadn't seen a vacuum cleaner for a while. Having said the above, the location could not be faulted. It was close to a lot of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay”
Reviews.Author: Seasoned1971
Reviews.Content: Room excellent with twin queen beds. Wi fi excellent. Coffee machine rubbish and our bath clogged. Bar service rubbish! Ideal location for shopping and not far to Vieux Point. Recommend open top bus tour.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bratman7
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times over the past year and a half. For the price you pay, you will not find anything better in downtown Montreal. The rooms are spacious, and some had hardwood flooring. I have been upgraded to a suite, and the suites are very large with bathrooms the size of my bedroom at home. As for the beds, mattresses, pillows, and covers were all new. Very comfortable nights there. Internet access is free like most hotels, however if you don't have a laptop, every room has a free destop to use! I have never seen that in a hotel before. As for location, at Rene-Levesque and Guy St, you are a block away from St Catherine with its restaurants and shops, and not too far from the bars on Crescent St. The Metro is a block away, and the Bell Centre is not too far away for concerts and hockey games. I have always had great stays here, and i wholeheartedly reccomend this hotel to travellers

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLEEEE CUSTOMER SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: kpuebla
Reviews.Content: I did a reservation with a special promotion rate for a weekend with my credit card, one day before my trip they called me and they told me that the price they gave me change and is 200 dollars more. After dealing with the horrible customer service treating you like if they are giving you the room for free I decided to cancel , the customer service is simply basic they dont care if you book the room at this hotel or not.... I really dont recommend this hotel and be aware of the rate scam !!! I had to spent a full day trying to search for an other hotel with a good rate, sorry but cheap hotel doesnt mean the unpolite , non educated and rude staff !!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for Grand Prix”
Reviews.Author: youngbruin
Reviews.Content: Went with friends 3 days to see Grand Prix race in Montreal ..what a great city. This hotel was close to all the events on crescent street .couple of minutes away from subway very convenient to get to the race ..no parking at the race! The people at the hotel were very nice into the event ..They had draws/ TV in the lobby for replays of the days event /FREE ESPRESSO coffee 24 hrs a day .NIce Parking lot well lit made you feel safe. $20 a day

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler58
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through hotwire (didn't know what hotel we would be booked in) and had never stayed here or heard of it so we weren't sure what to expect. I can say if I booked "blind" again and ended up with the Hotel Espresso, I would not be disappointed. I felt it was a good value for our money, and the location is perfect. We booked 2 rooms with the same reservation and were given joining rooms - perfect! Approx 4 blocks from Bell Centre (we were there to see a concert) and right between 2 metro lines (we took the Metro to the Casino - which took about 20-25 min and was VERY easy. We returned after the concert to find our air conditioner had leaked all over the floor. My boyfriend called the front desk and they sent up a maintenance person who simply brought some towels to soak up the mess. We decided we could do without the a/c for the night. I would not recommend the restaurant; we went in the morning after we checked out. The service was slow,, we didn't find the prices too high (as they usually are) UNTIL we saw the portion sizes. We would have just gone to a diner but figured it was easier to just leave the cars where they were since we had already paid for parking. For one night I would stay again, several nights I may book elsewhere...

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly acceptable hotel if you're not fussy about decor”
Reviews.Author: lovetosnorkel9
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Espresso in June 2011 for 2 nights. I would go back for sure. The suite (we were upgraded without asking) was spotlessly clean and the bed was extremely comfortable. We slept very well there. The reception and room service staff were very nice and helpful. Two staff delivered breakfast to our room. They seemed to want to please their guests. If you care about decor, this might not be the place for you. But if you want somewhere clean, with friendly staff and good prices, this could be the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Average NOT 4 star.”
Reviews.Author: travellingdoris
Reviews.Content: Good things: friendly staff, bed very comfortable, good A/C (not noisy), good hot water and water pressure, good wifi, good tv. Microwave and mini fridge in room. I was upgraded to a suite. Nice gesture. Probably upgraded because it was slightly disheveled. Would never ever pay their full price. Generally room clean, but dusty (vents, on lights, etc.), jacuzzi bathtub didn't work. had to leave shower on dribble or there was a horrific clunking and clanking in the pipes. Bathroom clean and clearly recently retiled. Hotel corridors - tired, old and worn. Did not do breakfast buffet. It would have been a rip off for the $12 they wanted. Food looked tired and unappetizing.

Reviews.Title: “Shady Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Auspex99
Reviews.Content: I recently attended this hotel as part of a conference. During the conference I was subject to non-criminal harassment by other hotel guests. This hotel has a lax security policy and did not deal with the matter professionally. If you have security concerns at this hotel, you will simply be told to call the police, which is about the least an establishment can do. I do not recommend staying at this hotel for this reason. Otherwise the rooms were fair for the price, but watch your back at this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: FrankD1202
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel and was an excellent experience. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The staff very courteous and friendly. We have stayed at many other hotels in the area before but this was the best experience I have had to date. I would recommend this hotel to ant one who wants to visit Montreal. The central location to downtown shops, restaurants and the Bell centre is great and you can walk almost anywhere. Taxis are also readily available if needed. And the price made it a great value. Overall a great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for its value”
Reviews.Author: KC123456789
Reviews.Content: Ive read quite a few reviews before going to this hotel. So when I finally decided to go I requested a room on the third floor guaranteeing it would be renovated. But the receptionist told me all the floors were now renovated except for the 7th floor, but she gave me the third floor room anyways so I cannot confirm if what she said was true. The renovated rooms are really nice for the price your paying. And the location is one of the best if you wanna walk around go for some drinks at a pub/bar/club and walk back home without having to worry about driving or a taxi. One note is that the headboard for my bed fell off the wall during my stay, and I was worried I would be charged for it. But they apologized for it and didn't charge me. Great customer service. Im a student that went with 4 friends.

Reviews.Title: “So gross.”
Reviews.Author: d3e
Reviews.Content: Do NOT stay here. The rooms were beyond disgusting. There was stains everywhere & it smelled like mold. Location wise, its close to the Bell Centre & the downtown core but you're better off staying somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Cheap for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Anget09
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and really well located downtown and near the Bell Centre. The room was really modern, two queen sized beds, a tv and a computer that we didn't use. The things that were wrong with the room: None of the lights worked (though in the bathroom they did), the computer fan was really loud so we turned it off. In the end, it didn't really make much of a difference since we were only there for one night and spent the evening out with friends. I would go there again if I was staying in Montreal on a budget. There were a lot of young people at the hotel, though we didn't hear them making any noise, i think there was a fraternity conference happening, not too sure. They definitely served a strong espresso upon checkout as well!

Reviews.Title: “Great price quality”
Reviews.Author: palisade52
Reviews.Content: For the price i found it to be extremely reasonable would floors lcd tvs and large rooms ..pay parking and good breakfast . Clean and very comfortable beds

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: PennyL83
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel with a group of 35 people... and everyone is on the same page as me. This was the dirtiest, smelliest hotel I have ever been to. DO NOT judge this place based on the pictures you see on the website because, as far as i`m concerned, it is false advertising. The pictures look NOTHING like the rooms.We walked in and was greeted with a disgusting stench. The carpets in the hallways were filthy, and the rooms` cleanliness were not up to part. I removed the blankets because i was disgusted with them. The computer did not work at all. And the price was FAR from reasonable. We paid $180 for a two bed room (which we booked online) and found out some of the people we came with only paid $99.. who also booked online. We complained at the front desk and they were so unhelpful. Biggest ripoff ever. With so many options of places to stay in Montreal, I would steer clear of this place.

Reviews.Title: “Completely underrated here”
Reviews.Author: nonecoo
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I've written a review here. I felt like I had to say something about this place. I stayed here for new years eve, despite reading poor reviews beforehand: This place is cheap, so you might expect that its a really low quality hotel. However, I have to say, for the price this was the nicest hotel I've ever stayed in. My room had a nice wood floor, mattress, and hdtv. On top of this, the hotel has a nice gym, sauna, and outdoor pool. They also give free espressos in the lobby! For New Years Eve, this place was especially a great place to stay. Its really close to the bars/clubs on crescent street... and the hotel was packed with like minded people. It was like spring break... girls were all over the hotel. I couldn't have been happier. But I do have to warn: If you're looking for a quiet place to sleep on a big tourist weekend, this place won't be good for you.

Reviews.Title: “not bad for price”
Reviews.Author: CHICKINESS
Reviews.Content: this place is ok. i wouldn't stay here again though. it's close to the downtown area and literally 1 light away from st. catherines street where all the shops and restos are.the carpets are old, but they look clean. my room was huge and mattress was comfortable and clean. there is free wifi which is great - but it's spotty. disconnects you every 20 mins or so which can get annoying. my room didn\t look like one of the rooms on the website though - the bed was an older model, and the bathroom was standard. the tub was a small low one. the service is not bad, but they don't go out of their way to even be polite, or say hello when you enter the lobby. when i got my key he didn't even point me in the direction of the elevator. the man rarely even looked up while i was paying. they boost room service but there is no room service menu - you have to call down and talk to someone who has no idea what they are doing/what is being served so i just went to st. catherines to eat. there is a tv and computer in the room, you have to pay to use the computer. but i had my netbook so it wasn't an issue. there is an iron, fridge and coffee maker. this place was fine for a one night stay ($101 total) since other hotels in the area are way more expensive ($200+)

Reviews.Title: “clean room, friendly staff, central location”
Reviews.Author: titocosta
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at this hotel with about 20 people among my friends and family members that gathered for an event in montreal. Everyone enjoyed their staying, the friendliness of the staff and a very convenient location to visit the city. We reserved about 7-8 rooms and they were all clean and fine. The hall as well as a couple of floors were recently renovated.

Reviews.Title: “not clean”
Reviews.Author: lovingcanada
Reviews.Content: On the morning of Oct 5th 2010 I found a used ladies underwear in my bed, at the foot end, under the top sheets. This is more then disgusting and proves that the bed sheets were not changed from the previous guest. Questioning what kind of training the cleaning staff/maids have had - if any, I strongly suggest not to use this hotel ever again, as I have found it unacceptably dirty on several occasions. Also I experienced that the front desk staff is not capable of handling a situation like this one. The man at the desk on that morning was extremely rude, did not respond to my complaint, as a matter of fact he didn't even look up at me from behind his desk.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Dirty Dirty Room - YUK :(”
Reviews.Author: CoronaBoy
Reviews.Content: STAY AWAY !!!! Stayed at this hotel for a weekend. Booked the room via Hotwire and this room is the featheriest, dirtiest and smelliest hotel I have ever stayed at in Montreal. I had to buy air fresheners to avoid the bad smell in the room. The heater/AC unit is so loud that I had to turn off at night. There was construction garbage in front of my room. The internet service was very slow and unreliable, but surprisingly they had a free computer in the room... The hotel was full of young drunk people and I could hear talking and loud music all day and night (not that it mattered much). The elevators were very slow and I had to use the stairs more than once as the elevators were broken down. The location is great on the other hand and within walking distance to shopping and restaurants. The front staff were friendly. Parking is $18 (taxes included) which is great and allows for in/out privileges. I would only stay at this hotel if on a budget and if you are ok with a 1 star hotel room quality. I spoke with front desk and they said that they are in the process of renovating. I am surprised the health department allows them to operate in such bad condition. Did I say that the rooms were dirty, real dirty..I did not even walk on the carpet with my socks had to wear shoes the whole time.. YUK.

Reviews.Title: “Very average ..... at best”
Reviews.Author: camfamincan
Reviews.Content: Accepting this is a basic low cost hotel in the city it has some pluses ... the central location, underground parking (costs extra) and it present OK in the lobby. The other side of the ledger - Staff weren't all that friendly or thelpful and our room while renovated (level 3) was VERY noisy. Everytime someone opened or closed their door on our floor it was like a mini earthquake. Also conversations from other rooms could easily be heard. Over our 3 nights they also had a function in the level 2 function room on Sat evening ... they may as well have been singing and dancing in our room until midnight it was that loud. All in all this hotel offers a cheap nights sleep (if there is no function on as you won't get much sleep then) but there are better options nearby we'll be booking next time.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite what I expected”
Reviews.Author: ljsmith35
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel thinking the pictures of the rooms online looked pretty decent... however, the room I received looked NOTHING like the renovated ones that were pictured. The decor was pretty awful and I searched high and low inspecting it for cleanliness. The carpets were really aged and dirty looking, the bathroom was clean but tiles were cracked... I did not want to sit on the chairs in the room. After the first night I started to relax a bit... the bed and linens were clean and I guess that was most important. The staff were friendly. The pool was nice because it was outdoor and summer time. The location was also pretty good, close walk to the metro and the shopping district, museums, etc. This was an inexpensive hotel for Montreal but next time I won't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “DON"T STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: anib1977
Reviews.Content: I was visiting Montreal with my husband, two sisters and mom for a long weekend. I booked the Hotel Espresso through Travelocity about a week before our arrival. When I booked the hotel it was listed as 3and a half stars and gave you a direct link to the hotel's website. It looked cute, modern and it said the hotel was recently renovated.I checked a few reviews. Some were bad, some were good. I honestly am not a picky person so I thought that the bad reviews were just people nit picking. How bad could it be,right? Boy was I wrong! First, the pictures online look NOTHING like the rooms we were put in. The rooms were NOT renovated since the 80's. The carpets were filthy and the rooms were dusty and so dry my sister had a nose bleed. The tub in our room wouldn't drain so every time I showered the tub would almost overflow. The internet hardly ever worked.The "restaurant/bar " in the hotel was only open for a few hours a day and they only served one disgusting item! I will say that Cindy at the front desk was very accommodating. Overall, this place is managed very poorly and the fact that they use blatant false advertising is a big NO in my book. Do yourself a favor and spend a few extra bucks a night and stay at a hotel not the motel Espresso!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and old”
Reviews.Author: Yelingshan
Reviews.Content: This hotel was rated much higher than it should be. I gather from some other reviews that maybe some of the rooms are renovated and nicer, but mine definitely was not. When we arrived the room was really dirty - the floors were obviously not vacuumed (plastic wrappers and food on the floor), and the two very old armchairs were so stained I didn't want to touch them or put any of my things on them. The drawers in the dresser were also stained and I didn't want my clothes going in there. The air conditioner is also about as wide as my arm span, noisy, and leaks water. When we left the next morning to go out I specifically asked the front desk to make sure our floors were vacuumed, but when we returned that afternoon they hadn't been. I called down to the front desk and after a half hour when no one had come I ventured out and found a cleaning woman and asked her to come in and do it. The location is decent for its proximity to downtown, but there are plenty of other hotels with as good or better location. I would NEVER stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Need to be renovated!!!”
Reviews.Author: CleoBs
Reviews.Content: We booked through Expedia the day before at a rate of $100. When we arrived at the front desk we had to wait for the 2 receptionists to finish their conversation. That could be fine if at least you have an eye contact!!!! The "espresso coffee" was served to another couple that was checking in at the same time but not to us. The room was big and overall cleand and it was ok for the rate we paid but the hotel, floors and rooms need to be renovated. The decor is very old and our armchair was unstitched and not very cleaned. We didn't have our own laptop but every room has its own except to the fact that it takes 10 minutes to open your email account page! We were thinking to extend our stay as we arrived late afteroon and didn't have enough time to visit the city but next day's rate was $145 so that, for that type of accomodation, we preferred to move to another nice B&B. Lucio at check out was very nice and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: disappointed181759
Reviews.Content: Had booked a room through Travelocity approximately one month prior to arrival date. When arrived at hotel, informed hotel was full and would arrange for room out by airport, 17 kms away. Not great for trying to spend time in the city. Hotel blamed Travelocity for confirming reservation with me without confirming with hotel. Surely someone would confirm or deny with someone (hopefully me) during that previous month if room not available. Bad deal all the way around.

Reviews.Title: “Did not meet expectations”
Reviews.Author: tripchick29
Reviews.Content: The rooms do not match what is represented on the website. There are 2 or 3 floors that have been renovated that look like the pictures on the hotel website. The other 5 floors are quite old with dirty carpets, broken furniture etc.... I gave this hotel a "poor" because I was very disappointed with the room we first received. I was expecting what was shown on the hotel website. To the Manager's credit, he offered us another room (which we took) that had been renovated when I complained. The Manager is the reason I scored "Service" higher on Trip Advisor's ratings system. The new room was very nice; too bad there's not more of them to go around. When I checked the hotel website today, before writing this review, I noticed the hotel website still has pictures of only the renovated rooms. Be aware that when you book, you may end up in a much, much older room. I have included photos of the first room we were booked in before we got into a renovated room. If you're OK with an old room, then you can get a great deal. If you want something that is close to 3 stars, then pay the $50 more and stay in a newer hotel in a better location.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected AT ALL”
Reviews.Author: Mikael92
Reviews.Content: The pictures of the hotel on the website are nothing alike of what the actual hotel is itself. The descriptions of the hotel were so much nicer than the actual hotel when we arrived. The location is also not so good if you want to be around the main part of the action which is on ST. CATHERINE STREET, it was about 1 block walk, and it was horrible for going out to bars and clubs at night when we would have to walk back. The rooms had a horrible odor, there was ugly carpeting, and we didnt expect the rooms to look like this at all. If you want a good hotel to be around the action, stay at NOUVEL HOTEL, or BEST WESTERN EUROPA..we found them to be the best, and in the best area's!

Reviews.Title: “Be Aware of What Room You Get”
Reviews.Author: tourist86
Reviews.Content: We make reservation on the hotel's website and got the old room. We were told only 2 floors had been renovated. The carpet was very very dirty and there was hair on the bathroom sink and floor. The toilet wasn't flushed. The mattress is old---its springs are worn out. The bedsheets seem to be clean though. The location is convenient, very close to St. Catherine. There is free wireless connection in the room and a free computer with internet access. The hotel staff is generally nice. And KUDOS to LUCIO for his fantastic service. He is very friendly and knowledgable.

Reviews.Title: “Good service”
Reviews.Author: americangrl
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice located close to Catherine street but far from Old Montreal if you like to walk. One morning we woke up to find what looked like a tick or bed bug in our room. They quickly took care of the problem and issued us another room and helped us move our things. Very accomidating to say the least . Very nice rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Read this review! It's important!!”
Reviews.Author: Keswin
Reviews.Content: Hi, there are a few things you have to know about this hotel before booking. It's located in a very good location of Montreal; close to everything e.g. Subway, st. Catherine street. We stayed here for 7 nights. I'm sure that you might probably heard about the bad things of this hotel but i really like to make it clear. 1. If you would like a room, make sure it's on the 4th floor cuz it's a whole new renovated floor. The rooms are all wooden-floor, new beds, new sheets, new paint, etc. 2. The rates for the rooms are cheaper in weekdays like regular hotels. But they could be high in weekends especially in summer. These are two things we found out about this hotel and we hope all people reading this review would be pleasant and satisfactory staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Professional Staff”
Reviews.Author: crusted
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights. The hotel has a fantastic location. Within a short 5 - 10 minutes walk there are lots of good quality restaurants and shops. We were extremely happy with the location. I was not happy with their room decor. It has a 70's look to it. I think our hotel room can use a little updating, but it seems there is an upgading process in effect. All the same the room was well equied, spacious and included a computer. Overall, the hotel offers a fantastic location, good services but only average decor.

Reviews.Title: “Great updated / renovated rooms ; great value !”
Reviews.Author: canuck64
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine came into Montreal and booked his room at Hotel Espresso. Since we had to leave early in the morning for our road trip, I decided to spend the night (he booked a room with two beds). I was pleasantly surprised with the room. The room was recently renovated with all the modern amenities. Great downtown location and easy access to major highways. He got a good rate by booking directly with the hotel. Staff was courteous and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Wondeful hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: hotelexpert15
Reviews.Content: During my recent vacation to Montreal, I had the pleasure of staying at the new hotel Espresso Montreal. I was there with my friends and we had a really good memorable experience in this hotel. It's walking distance from Ste-Catherine Street to the shopping center, near the subway station, near a variety of restaurants and clubs. The staff were pleasant and very helpful. We parked in their indoor parking which was really safe; itâ€™s more expensive but safer and easier then the outside one. I had a really nice sleep in their comfortable bed. No need to bring your computer cause there is one available in the room. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Alison043
Reviews.Content: I have been at Hotel Espresso and I loved it. Newly renovated, big rooms, centrally located with just few steps to St Catherine......and the buffet breakfast was amazing! The staff was very nice as well and I will go back there for sure! I highly recommend this hotel to everyone :)

Reviews.Title: “Tres Bien - Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jyoti05
Reviews.Content: To be honest, when I initially booked this trip on Hot Wire, I was disappointed. I'm used to staying in 4 and 5 star hotels when I book with Hot Wire, so when I was left having to stay in the Days Hotel on Guy St., you would have sworn someone told me I was going to have to stay "under a porch held up by sticks". I'm a hotel snob now...what can I say. Some of the reviews of this hotel...left me wondering...what am I getting myself into for 3 days. Let me start by saying looks are deceiving. The outside and certainly the picture that is online, are less than complimentary to what's inside...it makes it look very dated. When I arrived at check in... everyone was very, very nice and I breathed a sigh of relief after seeing the main lobby. It was much more modern and well taken care of than the posts that I've read. We had a room on the 4th floor and it was really nice. Don't get wrong, there were no robes, slippers, fridge, mini bar or Free Breakfast, but it was really nice. The decor was simple, but yet inviting. There were no rugs...it was hardwood floors and the A/C worked fine and didn't leak - like I expected it to after reading reviews. It was spotlessly clean, nicely decorated (flat screen TV, computer that I never quite figured out how to use - but on the 2nd flr. there are computers and printers) and it's in a great spot (if you like the downtown area). After seeing Old Montreal, I was partial to that neck of the woods, but if staying in Downtown Montreal in the future...I would book the Days Hotel. They also have a mini-store, spas, a small gym, and a nice size outdoor pool on site. It's $15 a day to park in their underground parkade. $15 doesn't seem like much, if you've ever parked in NYC for the evening. (I have yet to check my credit card bill, but I hope that it will reflect the price on the receipt that I received.) If not, then I'll have a problem probably more so with the bank and their foreign exchange fees, than the hotel. Cash is king as they say. This hotel is a block away from St. Catherine St. and a very short walk to the subway. Once you learn the subway system, you can go anywhere. We visited, Old Montreal, Mont Royal (go to the Tam Tam Festival on Sunday afternoons - it's a free festival where drummers come from everywhere and just stage an impromtu concert), Jean Talon Market (where the locals shop), and Olympic Park. So, yes, I'm giving this hotel a thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: funtush
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel over the hotwire. With tax and everything I paid 100 dollars and a sleepless night. After I got it I read the good reviews here. I was happy. But I was wrong. We had a terrible night. First of all we found that the beds were too old and smelly. Then the air conditioner (oldschool jumbo fat one) was too noisy. I turned it off but after a while the room got warmed up so we had to turn it on again with the loudy noise. There was a computer in the room but Internet stopped working in the morning. There was a hair dryer in the washroom but doest work at all. I complained. The receptionist was rude and completely non-friendly. With this same price you will get a much better hotel. And the location was not that great as advertised. I bet you can stay at the downtown core with this same price. Donâ€™t stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Days Inn Montreal”
Reviews.Author: ctahaney
Reviews.Content: Stayed here January 2004 for a weekend with friends to visit Montreal. It was okay. I really don't have any complaints about the place. The room was clean and acceptable. I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Standard hotel close to Bell Centre”
Reviews.Author: curlygirl123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in October 2008. Standard hotel in good location. Large rooms with dated dÃ©cor. Service Good service. Rooms Very large rooms and clean bathrooms. The dÃ©cor is dated but really not important and the location makes up for it. No fridge but they have an ice machine. Location -Great location two blocks from the Metro and the Bell Centre, two minute walk to restaurant and bar district, five minute walk to St. Catherine Street shopping. -Other restaurants and convenience stores across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, Great price and location”
Reviews.Author: Armeee
Reviews.Content: Great 2 queen room for $110 a night through Expedia. Parking also great rate at $15. Room was plain but clean. Showing age however.... Problem with room..... carpet soaked from A/C leaking onto floor. Staff not surprised..... happens all the time in this hotel they said. Changed to "remodeled" newer room. Only change was room had hardwood floors. Problem with staff........ chambermaid knocked on our door at 8 am........... asked me if we were checking out..... I had a few words for her and shut the door ...... checkout was not until 11 am. Complained to front desk about this...... and they turned up their nose and said she does not know who has or hasn't checked out. Said I should have "do not disturb" sign on door. Funny, we were only booked in for one night so they knew we would be out in the morning. Outdoor pool was clean and well kept Location perfect for our needs....

Reviews.Title: “Going in blind”
Reviews.Author: TripfinderToronto
Reviews.Content: I recently booked 3 rooms for my family and 2 other familes on one of those sites where you pay prior to finding out what hotel you end up in. Big mistake! To be fair the hotel was convienently located and some aspects of the hotel were ok. That's where it ends... I booked 3 "non smoking" rooms however one room reeked of smoke and we couldn't change the room. All rooms had badly stained carpets and chairs and my room actually had a section of buckled ceiling and chunks of wood missing out of the furniture. This place looked like a abused frat room. Not surprisingly both Fri / Sat night there was a lot of drunken yelling and slamming of doors all night to the point were one of the guests open his door and told them to %@&% keep it down. I did call the front desk at 2:30 am to see if someone could come up which they eventually did. Ironically earlier in the day the life guard at the pool told some kids not to yell too much because it might disturb the people in the rooms above (this was in the afternoon!!!!) Seems kids can't make noise during the day but it's alright for drunken patrons to yell and scream all night. Oh yes I did see a security guard in the lobby.......just wondering where we went at night?

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable, utilitarian hotel”
Reviews.Author: harpoon223
Reviews.Content: I was in Montreal for a conference at the Sheraton, which was booked, so I looked for a less expensive place nearby. This hotel (a few hundred meters away) worked out fine. It's not elegant, but it was clean and comfortable. The location is great, as other reviewers have noted; just few blocks from dozens of restaurants and the Centre Bell. They have a computer in each room; it runs some service that allows internet access. It was hard to figure out, but once I got it to work, it was fine and I didn't bother to get out my laptop. The French keyboard took some getting used to, though! The staff was polite enough. Overall, I was happy with the hotel. At about half the price of the Sheraton, I don' t mind skipping a few amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Location was the selling point for me...”
Reviews.Author: Mike W
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this Days Inn on 3 separate occasions (1/01, 8/01& 6/03)... For me the appeal of this place is the location... It's about a block away from the Centre Bell, and intersects with Ste-Catherine right in the heart of downtown. As far as the hotel is concerned, it's OK at best. Cheap priced, back then ('01-'03) it was only around $80 CAD (AAA rate) per night. The rooms were clean and big enough to fit 4 guys. (2 beds & floor space) The garage has enough room to move around in. The one down side that as stuck in my head over the years was the staff was a bit on the stuck up side, and they also had a guy posted in all the halls, "shhh-ing" you if you were talking at night... Not even loud, making noise type talking... But just simple conversation while walking down the hall got a "shhh" which really rubbed me the wrong way. All in all it's a 2 outta 5 hotel, but the good location bumps it up to a 3...

Reviews.Title: “nice place!”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler1980
Reviews.Content: OK, it's a Day's Inn, not the Radison. However, I was more than impressed during my stay at this hotel. It was very clean (especially the bathroom), quiet, roomy, friendly, and in a fantastic location. The staff was very helpful with directions and suggestions. The quality for the price can't be beat; we paid $90 per night for a comfortable king-sized bed. There was a computer in the room, and while we couldn't get it to work, we could plug in the ethernet cord into my laptop and get internet. It's less than a block away from the Guy-Concordia metro stop, right around the corner from St. Catherine's street, and has a Tim Horton's and Starbucks down the street. Downsides: no pool (well, it's outdoors), no continental breakfast (don't waste your money at the buffet in the restaurant downstairs), no pay-per-view, computer didn't work. Upsides: clean, large rooms, friendly staff, unbeatable location, fantastic price, in-room internet access if you bring your laptop. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this one....!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is terrible. Whatever you do, do not attepmt this hotel, it is nothing that is reported to be. My girlfriend and I stayed here from 07/14/06 - 07/16/06.
